Interface

Class CluedoFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • Interface.CluedoFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class CluedoFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    The Cluedo Frame class is used to setup the graphical user interface and handle different events caused by the players actions through out the game. The Cluedo interacts with mostly the game, board and canvas classes.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setRefutedCard

        public void setRefutedCard()
                    throws Game.InvalidAction
        Creates the pop up to ask refuting player to choose card to refute. It then sets the refuted card field as the card or null so the suggesting player can see and get an hint to what may be the solution
        Throws:
        Game.InvalidAction - exception for invalid action

      • pickCard

        public Card pickCard(java.util.List<Card> refutableCards)
        Makes a pop up for refuting player to choose the card they wish to let teh suggesting player see.
        Parameters:
        refutableCards - the list of refutable cards
        Returns:
        Card refuted card

        message - the message of the dialog
        Returns:
        yes or no

      • isEndTurn

        public boolean isEndTurn()
        Determines if the current player's turn is finished or not.
        Returns:
        true if the current player clicked the end turn button, otherwise false

      • isMoveTurn

        public boolean isMoveTurn()
        Determines if the current player still has any moves left.
        Returns:
        true if there is no more moves, otherwise false
